thread.title: Bihar Assembly elections 2015: Political campaigns end for first phase, election to begin from October 12
thread.title_full: Bihar Assembly elections 2015: Political campaigns end for first phase, election to begin from October 12

author: Saurav Mukherjee
title: Bihar Assembly elections 2015: Political campaigns end for first phase, election to begin from October 12
text:
Bihar Assembly elections 2015: Political campaigns end for first phase, election to begin from October 12 By Saurav Mukherjee on October 10, 2015 at 6:02 PM Comments 
Patna, October 10: The campaigning for the first phase of elections has come to an end on Saturday at 5 pm. With this no party would be able to be organise a political rally or allege against each other till the first phase of elections are over, which is scheduled to be on October 12. With the model code of conduct is in effect from last month and the political parties indulging in rallies after September 26, now the fate of the leaders are in the hands of voters. In the first phase of election, 49 constituencies will go for polls out of 243 seats. 
The Chief Election Commissioner Nasim Zaidi had announced the five phase of elections on September 9. As per to the scheduled election dates, first phase will take place on October 12, second on October 16, third on October 28, fourth on November 1 and the last and the fifth one will take place on November 5. The date of declaring the fate of candidates has been scheduled on November 8, when the results for all the five phases will be announced. (Also Read: Election dates for Bihar assembly election announced; Five phase elections from October 12 ) 
In order to ensure fair elections in Bihar, the ECI has deployed Central Reserve Police Force personnel in the state, as 67 of the total 243 Assembly constituencies in Bihar have been said as ‘sensitive’ from candidates’ expenditure point. Though the ECI had said that the threat of muscle of power has significantly decreased in comparison to previous elections, but it don’t want to take any risk. The ECI had also said that it will commission will adopt a measure of zero-tolerance policy towards the offenders. 
  6:16 PM Topics:
